comments.commentBody: No way he makes it to the end of the year.
I'm counting down the days and hours until we hear "My fellow Americans, our long national nightmare is over... Our Constitution works; our great Republic is a government of laws and not of men..."
The scary part of this - what happens when he is faced with a serious crisis - military or otherwise - where he has to apply depth of understanding and critical thinking skills?

I did not like thee, W,
The reign of Cheney made me blue
I huzzahed when your terms were through,
I dd not like thee , W.

I do despise thee Donald Trump,
The Bill of Rights you're bound to dump,
Your cortex is a mishmash lump,
I do despise thee Donald Trump.
Oh Larry, I love this poem. You have made my day.
Trump needs to be punished when he broadcast baseless accusations.  Can't people sue him or something?  All of America should not be reduced to Steve Bannon's internet.
Trump needs to immediately provide hard evidence to back up his claims, or else have them considered as just another sign of his crumbling sanity.

I don't disagree with your diagnosis of Trump...  But your assumption that Pence is somehow better is arguable.  Pence is a slick operator who knows how to get things done...  And his agenda is, in my opinion, in some ways worse.

Of course the so-called president can be banned from Twitter. Yiannopolous (sorry if spelled wrong) was permanently banned for his malicious activity.

However, given that the entire republican delegation in Congress lacks the spine to address 45's unethical behavior, it is a sure thing that the CEO of Twitter isn't about to take him on.

We have entered another level of insanity for this administration and it is no longer amusing. I suggest those who care should seek a realistic solution by contacting Republican senators who may be willing to act for the best of the country. McCain, Graham, probably Susan Collins, Hoeven of N Dak, other midwestern R senators who are conservative but can spot an unhinged leader when confronted with this mess, they are all good candidates to reach out to for help to do what is best for this country. He needs to be gotten under oath somehow.  An investigation of anything. Then his instincts will take him where he needs to go and an impeachable offense will surely result. I know the policies of his replacement may be even worse, but now our country is in real danger and the first thing is to get rid of the tumor.
This is beginning to look like a grifter finally realizing he is out of his depth.
I'm fairly sure that Trump's not capable of realizing that.
Well said

At the risk of betraying my age, I'd like to point out that Cecil the Seasick Sea Serpent was a puppet before he was a toon. Bob Clampett's Time for Beanie was a puppet show from 1949 to 1954; it was revived as a cartoon show in 1962 and went off the air for good in 1967. Like all great children's literature, it was written to please adults, featuring zany characters like Tearalong the Dotted Lion and a singing manta ray taking off on pop singer Johnny Ray, not to mention a sendup of King Kong. One of the greatest injustices known to history was Macy's failure to include Beanie and Cecil in their Thanksgiving Day parade. It still gets my goat.

I had never heard of the TV show, the sea serpent (they have names??) etc. Thank goodness for the crosses.
We got a TV in 1958, but were allowed to watch 'only educational shows.' You know, like Lawrence Welk..... LOL
Clarification:  I only saw the one puppet version.  Wasn't even aware it had become a cartoon.
Beanie and Cecil! Thank you, FB, for the nostalgia!

Any day now Trump will complain someone stole his strawberries. He'll be turning over silver balls in his little hands and muttering to himself, but this time the ship will be the democracy of the United States, not The Caine.

More shocking than 45's baseless accusations is the willingness of his supporters, including members of Congress, to support and defend them. People who have no authority over others are run out of their jobs on an almost daily basis for their social media posts. However, the more outrageous 45 is on social media, the more the crowd cheers.  I am sick.
It's getting to be 25th amendment time. Whether by temperament, mental illness, or astonishing lack of knowledge and effort to learn his job, this president is disabled.

Another head fake. Trump's MO is just accuse someone else of what he does to hide what he is doing. No surprise, Trump's mentor was Roy Cohn, co-founder of McCarthyism with Tail Gunner Joe. Trump and his minions are dirty and he's trying to hide it by throwing some at Obama. But the real problem is still out there in plain view: its what he and his minions were talking about with the Russians, not the FBI listening to them do it. Congressional Republicans, you better be listening real closely, too; every one of you is getting dirtier every hour you stall an independent investigation with public hearings into Trump's Russian connections. Time to choose, which is it, party or country?
Yep, and as far as McCarthy is concerned we know how it ultimately ended for him and, to say the least, it was NOT good.

More smoke and mirrors from the Liar in Chief... another side show under the circus tent designed to distract from the real story...

As the media gets closer and closer to the conspiratorial truth behind the fraudulent election, we will likely see a lot more of this fake sensationalist drivel oozing out of Trump Tower...

This is what desperation looks like, Folks.

The National Embarrassment posing as President continues...

How much longer do we have to put up with these paranoid, delusional statements from the person who is supposed to be the leader of our nation? At this point someone must be wondering about the state of his mental health.
Two months gone.Forty six to go.More than enough time to turn your country into a total madhouse.Putin,Kim Yong Un and co. are already laughing their heads of.

Trump has cut his own throat - he has nobody in the pipeline to replace Obama's people who now don't care what they do to damage him. Furthermore, he called out Obama who has been straining to be neutral and now has no reason to continue to do so. Bannon and Prievus were apparently not informed of this snafu because Trump cannot be controlled and has just dug his own political grave.
What will emerge over the next few days and weeks will be disaster for him unless he is planning some disaster for us to distract from his incompetence.

Do you think he has just been made aware of something the wiretaps revealed? Perhaps the FBI has some questions for Mr Trump. If his communications were being monitored it must have been under warrant so maybe just maybe the failing Mr Trump will be taken into custody at last.

He's scared. Now without Sessions to protect him...he is going to get caught.

He was a known con, liar, and untrustworthy businessman who swindled people (his university) and yet people put him into office.

Never mind that he started this political turn by insulting President Obama---questioning Obama's citizenship. He should not have been electable for that alone.

No evidence of charge. Guilty.

No one contacted the Russians before the election. He called openly for Russia to interfere. Guilty.

The elections were rigged. They were but not by the Democrats for several reasons including Clinton II's belief that she was elected a year before being nominated and general incompetence. Guilty.

Sessions lied. Guilty.

Let's all be friends since I won despite doing everything possible to divide. Guilty.

Obama is not a native born American. Yes, he is and now let's forget what I Trumped lied about without facts or proof, Guilty.

Obama tapped (or groped) my phones. No proof. Guilty of lies again.

I have no need to confess sins or seek forgiveness of any God. Guilty.

I am going to make America great again. Guilty of making America small to make it look greater.

Supporters of hot air passed through the rectum (to 'trump'
means that in England) and critics should add to their must read books "Trump" by Wayne Barrett. If you can't stomach reading it from start to finish, at least read the last section or even just the last ten pages. Making the deal means payoffs, lies, working the mob.....

In the meantime, on Peanut Island in the Intra-coastal Waterway not too far from West Palm Beach in Florida there is a once secret bomb shelter built if memory recalls correctly during Kennedy's presidency. Trump at first wanted to rename the island and shelter as Trump Island and Trump Reverse Tower. Now he wants to keep it a secret!

I wonder why?
Gioco, You are being sarcastic right?
FOIA now...Trump has put that out there.  Now FOIA for it.

Former presidents refrain from criticizing current presidents, and they have shown considerable restraint lately. Yet somehow Mr. Trump feels it's perfectly fine to call Obama a bad or even sick guy. Does he draw the line anywhere? Without offering up any proof or evidence, he's more and more looking like a man ranting about nothing and claiming to be a victim. And he's looking more and more unfit mentally to be in the oval office. Little wonder his staff looks like they haven't slept in weeks and could all use a vacation about now.

The trouble with wiring the world for universal social media was always that someone would declare themselves king or queen and be so influential that they could easily control the minds of millions of people.

This idolatry was exactly what the United States republic was set up to avoid. And now here it is. Monarchy all over again.
